description: A quick, practical guide to Humor in Cross-Cultural Deals.

hook.text: A joke that kills in New York might kill the deal in Tokyo.

discovery.text: British negotiators use irony to build rapport. German negotiators prefer direct, humor-free discussions.

twist.text: Misunderstood humor is worse than no humor â€” it creates confusion, offense, or loss of credibility.

climax.text: When unsure, avoid humor entirely. When the relationship is strong, let it emerge naturally.

punchline.text: If you have to explain the joke, you shouldn't have told it.
